name: Event
description: An event happening at a certain time and location, such as a concert, lecture, or festival. Ticketing information may be added via the offers property. Repeated events may be structured as separate Event objects.
title: Event

fields.name: about
fields.title: about
fields.description: The subject matter of the content.

fields.name: funder
fields.title: funder
fields.description: A person or organization that supports (sponsors) something through some kind of financial contribution.

fields.name: sponsor
fields.title: sponsor
fields.description: A person or organization that supports a thing through a pledge, promise, or financial contribution. e.g. a sponsor of a Medical Study or a corporate sponsor of an event.

fields.name: subEvent
fields.title: subEvent
fields.description: An Event that is part of this event. For example, a conference event includes many presentations, each of which is a subEvent of the conference.

fields.name: workFeatured
fields.title: workFeatured
fields.description: A work featured in some event, e.g. exhibited in an ExhibitionEvent.       Specific subproperties are available for workPerformed (e.g. a play), or a workPresented (a Movie at a ScreeningEvent).

fields.name: audience
fields.title: audience
fields.description: An intended audience, i.e. a group for whom something was created.

fields.name: remainingAttendeeCapacity
fields.title: remainingAttendeeCapacity
fields.description: The number of attendee places for an event that remain unallocated.

fields.name: actor
fields.title: actor
fields.description: An actor, e.g. in tv, radio, movie, video games etc., or in an event. Actors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

fields.name: endDate
fields.title: endDate
fields.description: The end date and time of the item (in ISO 8601 date format).

fields.name: doorTime
fields.title: doorTime
fields.description: The time admission will commence.

fields.name: contributor
fields.title: contributor
fields.description: A secondary contributor to the CreativeWork or Event.

fields.name: maximumAttendeeCapacity
fields.title: maximumAttendeeCapacity
fields.description: The total number of individuals that may attend an event or venue.

fields.name: typicalAgeRange
fields.title: typicalAgeRange
fields.description: The typical expected age range, e.g. '7-9', '11-'.

fields.name: organizer
fields.title: organizer
fields.description: An organizer of an Event.

fields.name: aggregateRating
fields.title: aggregateRating
fields.description: The overall rating, based on a collection of reviews or ratings, of the item.

fields.name: offers
fields.title: offers
fields.description: An offer to provide this itemâ€”for example, an offer to sell a product, rent the DVD of a movie, perform a service, or give away tickets to an event. Use businessFunction to indicate the kind of transaction offered, i.e. sell, lease, etc.

fields.name: inLanguage
fields.title: inLanguage
fields.description: The language of the content or performance or used in an action. Please use one of the language codes from the IETF BCP 47 standard. See also availableLanguage.

fields.name: attendee
fields.title: attendee
fields.description: A person or organization attending the event.

fields.name: workPerformed
fields.title: workPerformed
fields.description: A work performed in some event, for example a play performed in a TheaterEvent.

fields.name: eventStatus
fields.title: eventStatus
fields.description: An eventStatus of an event represents its status; particularly useful when an event is cancelled or rescheduled.

fields.name: startDate
fields.title: startDate
fields.description: The start date and time of the item (in ISO 8601 date format).

fields.name: director
fields.title: director
fields.description: A director of e.g. tv, radio, movie, video gaming etc. content, or of an event. Directors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

fields.name: superEvent
fields.title: superEvent
fields.description: An event that this event is a part of. For example, a collection of individual music performances might each have a music festival as their superEvent.

fields.name: duration
fields.title: duration
fields.description: The duration of the item (movie, audio recording, event, etc.) in ISO 8601 date format.

fields.name: translator
fields.title: translator
fields.description: Organization or person who adapts a creative work to different languages, regional differences and technical requirements of a target market, or that translates during some event.

fields.name: previousStartDate
fields.title: previousStartDate
fields.description: Used in conjunction with eventStatus for rescheduled or cancelled events. This property contains the previously scheduled start date. For rescheduled events, the startDate property should be used for the newly scheduled start date. In the (rare) case of an event that has been postponed and rescheduled multiple times, this field may be repeated.

fields.name: review
fields.title: review
fields.description: A review of the item.

fields.name: location
fields.title: location
fields.description: The location of for example where the event is happening, an organization is located, or where an action takes place.

fields.name: recordedIn
fields.title: recordedIn
fields.description: The CreativeWork that captured all or part of this Event.

fields.name: composer
fields.title: composer
fields.description: The person or organization who wrote a composition, or who is the composer of a work performed at some event.

fields.name: isAccessibleForFree
fields.title: isAccessibleForFree
fields.description: A flag to signal that the item, event, or place is accessible for free.

fields.name: performer
fields.title: performer
fields.description: A performer at the eventâ€”for example, a presenter, musician, musical group or actor.

fields.name: identifier
fields.title: identifier
fields.description: The identifier property represents any kind of identifier for any kind of Thing, such as ISBNs, GTIN codes, UUIDs etc. Schema.org provides dedicated properties for representing many of these, either as textual strings or as URL (URI) links.
